text: was a very old province of Japan in the area of Hyūga Province on the island of Honshū.Brinkley, Frank. (1915). A History of the Japanese People from the Earliest Times to the End of the Meiji Era, p. 40. Its boundaries are within Miyazaki Prefecture. ==History== Komaso is part of the tale of Yamato Takeru which is recorded in the Kojiki.Burke, Stephania, "Hero's Journey for the Yamato Takeru Myth in Kojiki (712)" , History Through Literature Project, Office of Resources for International and Area Studies (ORIAS) at the University of California, Berkeley; retrieved 2012-6-24. The history of Komaso started and ended before the Taihō Code was established at the beginning of the 8th century. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==Notes== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Miyazaki Prefecture
title: Kumaso Province
